thread.title: Hundreds evacuated from Hamburg airport after unknown toxin spreads through air conditioning | The Independent
thread.title_full: Hundreds evacuated from Hamburg airport after unknown toxin spreads through air conditioning | The Independent

author: Chloe Farand
title: Hundreds evacuated from Hamburg airport after unknown toxin spreads through air conditioning | The Independent
text:
Hundreds evacuated from Hamburg airport after unknown toxin spreads through air conditioning 
Flights have been suspended until at least 2pm German time Sunday 12 February 2017 13:24 GMT Click to followThe Independent Online 
Hundreds of passengers have been evacuated from Hamburg Airport after 50 people were injured by an unknown toxin believed to be spreading through the airport's air conditioning system. 
All flights have been suspended during the evacuation. 
Spokeswoman for the airport, Karen Stein, said: "We have cancelled all flights at least until 2pm, and most parts of the airport have been evacuated." 
Travellers have been complaining about breathing problems and burning eyes and were examined by firefighters at the airport to find out whether they had to go to hospital, German news agency dpa reported. 
People evacuated from the hospital had tow wait outside the terminals in freezing temperatures. 
Doctors were examining those injured by the unknown toxin in a specially designated area outside the airport. 
More follows
